alert.note: Alert for Angelina; Cherokee; Gregg; Harrison; Nacogdoches; Panola; Rusk; Sabine; San Augustine; Shelby; Smith (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 23 at 10:28PM CDT until August 24 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CDT THURSDAY EVENING FOR CRITICAL TO EXTREME FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS NEAR AND SOUTH OF THE I-20 CORRIDOR OF EAST TEXAS, NORTHERN AND CENTRAL LOUISIANA... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CDT THURSDAY FOR CRITICAL TO EXTREME FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS NEAR AND SOUTH OF THE I-20 CORRIDOR OF EAST TEXAS AND NORTHERN AND CENTRAL LOUISIANA... * AFFECTED AREAS...Fire districts across East Texas, Northern and Central Louisiana along and south of the Interstate 20 corridor. * TIMING...Through 8 PM Thursday evening. * WINDS...Northeast 5 to 10 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 25 percent. * TEMPERATURES...Up to 107. * IMPACTS...Rapid ignition and spread of wildfires is possible due to persistent hot and dry conditions.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that extreme fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and dry vegetation can contribute to extreme fire behavior. Avoid all outside burning and welding today. Do not toss lit cigarette butts outside. Report wild fires to the nearest fire department or law enforcement office.
